abstract.para: Ensure that you install the freeradius-server and freeradius-server-utils packages on a separate machine from your Network Access Server (NAS).

topic.para: In the main FreeRADIUS configuration directory, /etc/raddb/, various files are directories are created. The key files are:

listitem.para: radiusd.conf, the main configuration file that includes clients, modules, and sites and this controls the logging, security, and threading.
clients.conf defines the RADIUS clients and the IP and shared secret are saved in this file.
users or mods-config/files/authorize contains the list of users.
sites-available defines how requests are processed and this contains the authentication flow.
mods-enabled contains symnlinks and FREERADIUS loads only the modules available in this directory.
/etc/raddb/certs/ contains TLS certificates for EAP, PEAP, TTLS and includes ca.pem, server.pem, server.key, client.pem.
